description: alpha-2 antiplasmin (α2AP, also called α2-plasmin inhibitor), a member of the serpin superfamily, is a heterogeneous protein possessing unique N- and C-terminal ends of which the N-terminus is involved in α2AP incorporation into a clot and the C-terminus in the initial interaction of α2AP with plasmin(ogen).
name: Alpha 2 antiplasmin Antibodies and Antigens
